posts.post_content:
A wonderful, hilarious response to [Sphinx's Revelation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx's Revelation).

Posted By: Doaj (1/28/2013 2:31:23 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I give it a 4/5.  
  
It's useful in limited just for the pure burn. There's a little bit of Johnny potential in there, but the most clever thing I can think of is preventing the lifegain from Extort. (Just make sure to respond to the Extort trigger(s). Skullcrack's gotta resolve first.\*)  
  
However, I see a much better use for this card. Allow me to state it in an exclamation: "\*\*\*\* YOU, TURBO[FOG](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=FOG)!"  
  
  
  
\*And on that note, if YOU have any Extort triggers, they'll go on top of Skullcrack and resolve first; thus, you can gain life from those Extort triggers before Skullcrack prevents it.
posts.html:
I give it a 4/5.

It's useful in limited just for the pure burn. There's a little bit of Johnny potential in there, but the most clever thing I can think of is preventing the lifegain from Extort. (Just make sure to respond to the Extort trigger(s). Skullcrack's gotta resolve first.*)

However, I see a much better use for this card. Allow me to state it in an exclamation: "**** YOU, TURBOFOG!"



*And on that note, if YOU have any Extort triggers, they'll go on top of Skullcrack and resolve first; thus, you can gain life from those Extort triggers before Skullcrack prevents it.

posts.post_content: when i first saw it i was like meh, i already have [flames of the blood hand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=flames of the blood hand) in my draw-to-burn deck. but after actually substituting flames out and giving skullcrack a go... wow. 1) the mana cost is lower--1a. [izzet guildmage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=izzet guildmage) can copy this; 1b. you can put it on a [stick](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=292752); 1c. ...the mana cost is lower! 2) nullifying [life](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=122438)[-gain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=185743) and damage [pre](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=87600)[ven](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=135248)[tion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=130554) doesn't just work for this card, but for all of the burn cards for the rest of the turn, for every player. all this for only -1 damage. solid trade-off and works better for tempo... mostly because... the mana cost is lower! for izzet, you'd be surprised at how much that 1 mana makes a difference--it becomes a matter if i can throw an extra autocard... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: @Lifegainwithbite Because Leyline of Punishment is not in standard, costs two more mana, and deals no damage... This card knocks down Thragtusk and Sphinx's Revelation, and turns off fog. Is it main deck worthy? Probably not, but in a sideboard it is worth the slots.
posts.html:
@Lifegainwithbite Because Leyline of Punishment is not in standard, costs two more mana, and deals no damage... This card knocks down Thragtusk and Sphinx's Revelation, and turns off fog. Is it main deck worthy? Probably not, but in a sideboard it is worth the slots.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: doombladez (2/10/2013 1:51:21 AM)
Rating:

@Doaj: Why? Why would you run this over Incinerate or Pillar of Flame unless you knew for a fact your opponent was running loads of lifegain? Most decks run little to no lifegain and if you're that determined to stop a lifegain deck, run Leyline of Punishment.
Far too situational and since it can only strike players, it doesn't deserve much of a rating.

@Darthparallax: Situational removal is really important for aggro decks and since this can only strike players, cards that can strike creatures or players are much preferable to being able to counter the small amounts of lifegain most decks would run. Aggro is made a lot harder if your opponents can block.
And I know this would be helpful against my lifegain deck but if someone really wanted to stop it, they could just run leyline of punishment.
